title: Cookies & Cache
intro: Dock 23. Late night. Something doesn't smell right, and it's not just the fish market. A shipment went missing, and you're the only one smart enough to follow the crumbs.
overview: As a private eye, you often get hired to look into things the police usually won't. Like a missing shipment of guns from the DeadLock Crew. It appears from the sparse information I was given (as usual), it's not surprising that one of the local mobs doesn't want the police involved. I should start my search where the shipment vanished, looks like we are visiting dock 23.

settings.name: Setting #1: Outside a dock house like in San Francisco
interactables: Locked door (player needs a crowbar to open the door)
Tire tracks (showcases the truck did leave the warehouse)
Searchable dumpster (Contains crowbar needed to jam open door)

settings.name: Setting #2: Inside the dock house facing towards the door
interactables: Shipping terminal (needs password. Shows where the scheduled shipment was supposed to go. Main character makes remark about how they put the 'organized' into organized crime)
Sticky note left on computer (contains login information)
Digital truck scale (shows logs of the weight of the trucks before each shipment. Reveals that the last truck was extremely light compared to the others.)
Hallway (leads to the back half of the warehouse)

settings.name: Setting #3: Inside the dock house facing towards the back
interactables: Hallway (leads to the front half of the warehouse)
Office (contains more clues in the next room)

settings.name: Setting #4: Inside the office
interactables: Filing cabinets (inside is a written report on the amount of guns that have entered the warehouse)
Photograph on the desk (has a date written on it)
Computer on the desk (After breaking into the computer using the date on the photograph, the player can login to the email of the last user, due to remaining cookies from the last session)

Email exchange inside computer (Email chain showing that the current person in charge of the shipments is a turncoat. They are planning on selling the weapons in the shipment and everything in the warehouse to a rival gang.)

key_point: The weapons never left the warehouse (hence the light truck and the selling plan).

choices.text: Do as Hired. Report back to the gang the information you have found.
choices.result: The DeadLock Crew nods and pays up. What they do with the traitor? Not your problem.

choices.text: Good Citizen. Report the weapon shipment/turncoat information to the police.
choices.result: Anonymous tips lead to sirens in the night. You watch from the shadows, conscience clean.

choices.text: Sellout. Sell the information to a rival gang, enabling them to steal the shipment.
choices.result: You get your payday — and they get the drop. The dock never sees another shipment again.

tip: Never leave cookies behind — they remember everything you've done. One forgotten login is all it takes for someone to get inside your life.
